title: Rail Procurement and Analytics Specialist
description:
CHS Inc. is a leading global agribusiness owned by farmers, ranchers and cooperatives across the United States that provides grain, food and energy resources to businesses and consumers around the world. We serve agriculture customers and consumers across the United States and around the world. Most of our employees are in the United States, but today we have employees in 19 countries. At CHS, we are creating connections to empower agriculture.

**Summary**
-----------



CHS is seeking a Senior Procurement Specialist to support strategic sourcing, supplier negotiations, and contract management for rail transportation. This role focuses on driving cost\-effective procurement outcomes through supplier strategy, performance management, and data\-driven rate analysis using CHS freight procurement systems and tools.


The position requires strong experience in freight contracting, vendor negotiations, and maintaining accurate rate and supplier data to support enterprise\-wide decision making.

**Responsibilities**
--------------------


* Lead analysis, sourcing and negotiation activities with Class I and Shortline railroad agreements
* Develop and manage procurement strategies that improve cost competitiveness, service reliability, and supplier accountability across the rail network
* Utilize CHS freight procurement and rate management systems including Tratics to maintain accurate pricing, contract terms, and supplier performance data
* Conduct freight rate analysis, market benchmarking, and cost modeling to support contract negotiations and annual sourcing strategies
* Identify savings opportunities through competitive bidding, contract optimization, supplier consolidation, and rebate or incentive structures
* Partner with internal stakeholders across Operations, Logistics, Finance, and Commercial teams to align procurement decisions with business needs
* Support development of standardized procurement policies, processes, and reporting tools to improve governance and compliance across rail spend
* Identify rate discrepancies that lead to invoice errors and correct root cause
* Maintain strong supplier relationships while ensuring adherence to CHS safety expectations and operational standards
* Perform other procurement\-related responsibilities as assigned
* 
**Minimum Qualifications (required)**
-------------------------------------


* High School diploma or GED
* 4\+ years of experience in Supply Chain and/or Procurement
* Proficiency in Microsoft Word, PowerPoint, Access, and Excel
**Additional Qualifications**
-----------------------------


* Bachelors degree in Business, Supply Chain, Logistics, or related field
* Experience supporting rail or freight transportation procurement at an enterprise level
* Advanced knowledge of freight rate structures, contract negotiations, and supplier performance management
* Experience with PowerBI creation, JDE, SAP, Tratics, and Kaleris
* Strong communication, analytical, and relationship\-building skil...

title: Transload Operator I
description:
Overview:

Lewis Energy Group is a vertically integrated E\&P Company. We are one of the top national gas producers in South Texas and in the nation. We operate in South Texas and have international operations. We are proud of the family\-oriented work culture we have built over the decades. This culture carries into the pride we take in our work and in the communities, we operate in.  

The **Transload Operator** will be responsible for transfering dry bulk products; frac sand, proppants, and other products; to/from railcars and trucks in a safe and efficient manner while maintaining facility and equipment used.
Responsibilities:
**Essential Duties and Resposibilities:**
Unloads/loads railcars; to include non\-bulk items.  

Operates all equipment related to transload operation which includes but is not limited to: mobile conveyers, generators, portable light sets, lite duty vehicles, tractors, railcar/gate openers, forklifts, and loaders.  

Operates portable hand tools; power and non\-power, in accordance with all safety and operating rules.  

Starts, stops, and operates engines and portable pumps in accordance with all safety and operation rules.  

Performs general maintenance of all equipment used in transload operations, reporting any deficiencies that require further maintenance.  

Communicates with team members to control and direct transload activities.  

Observes, interprets and relays verbal and non\-verbal communications; radio, phone, hand signals, lantern signals, switch target indicators, flags, and lights.  

Conducts all written and verbal reporting in a timely and accurate manner.  

Complies with all company and federal safety rules, policies and procedures to include wearing required safety equipment, responding to safety concerns and taking appropriate action when needed.  

Takes an active role in safety programs including attendance to all safety meetings and ensures safe behaviors of self and coworkers.  

Performs general housekeeping and cleaning. **Supervisory Responsibilities**
  

This job has no supervisory responsibilities.
Qualifications:
**Qualifications**

  



**Education and/or Experience**
High school diploma or general education degree (GED); and a minimum one year related experience and/or training.

  

  

**Certificates, Licenses, Registrations**  

Valid state issued driver's license.  

  

**Other Skills and Abilities**
  

Ability to work independently and with minimal supervision.  

Ability to work as part of a team and maintain a good attitude.  

  

**Other Qualifications**
  

Prior experience working on or around rail operation.  

Ability and willingness to work an irregular schedule including nights, weekends, and holidays to support a 24 hour a day 7 day a week operation.

title: Lead Transload Operator
description:
Grow Your Career with Savage!
  
Savage is a global provider of supply chain infrastructure and logistics solutions with more than 200 locations across the United States, Canada, Mexico and Saudi Arabia. Since we were founded in 1946, weve grown from a small family business to an international company with more than 4,000 team members. Were proud to be recognized as a Military Friendly Employer and a Top Company for Women to Work in Transportation. Savage is a place where your growth is supported and your impact matters. Join us and do things you never dreamed possible.
  
To Apply for this position, click on the "Apply" button above and complete the application.
  
  

This job is located in Safford, AZ.
  
  

These are just a few of the benefits you can expect from working with Savage:
  
* Starting pay is $27\.00 per hour
* A culture that appreciates our Team Members
* Uniforms and laundry service
* Paid Time Off (PTO)
* Paid holidays
* Built\-in overtime
* Profit Sharing
* Excellent benefits including medical, dental, vision, life, disability, 401(k)
* A culture of safety
* A commitment to helping our Team Members do things that they never dreamed possible.


The Lead Operator's responsibility includes, but is not limited t,o safely and efficiently managing the unloading of incoming sulfur railcars, spotting the sulfur railcars, and assisting in the general maintenance and cleanup of the plant and equipment at our Morenci, AZ operation.
  
  

**Requirements of a successful Lead Operator:**  

* Lead team to perform daily inspections of railcars, tractor\-trailers, and equipment to ensure safe conditions and operation
* Railcar/transfer preparation, including installing bolt\-on/bolt\-off fittings, making hose connections, taking product samples, and housekeeping of the facility
* Lead team to conduct numerous transfers of liquid bulk chemicals from tank cars to tank trucks each day
* Perform routine maintenance on equipment and the facility
* MSHA experience and exposure a plus, but not required
* High School Diploma/GED
* Prior experience handling bulk hazardous materials a plus, but not required


**Here are some of the physical requirements of this role:**  

* Work outdoors year\-round in all conditions
* Walk several miles per day
* Lift 50 lbs. without assistance
* Climb/stoop/crawl
* Work on elevated surfaces
* Work in all types of weather conditions


**Additional Information:**

title: Customs Brokerage Specialist, Amazon Customs & Trade (ACT) Destination Operations
description:
**DESCRIPTION**
---------------


Application deadline: Feb 26, 2026  

  

At Amazon, our mission is to be Earth's most Customer\-centric company. The Amazon Customs \& Trade (ACT) team delivers comprehensive customs brokerage services for our customers.  

  

We are seeking a detail\-oriented Customs Brokerage Specialist to join our team. In this role, you will manage daily customs clearance operations for ocean, air, rail, and truck cross\-border shipments. The position involves collaborating with freight forwarders, sellers, and vendors to ensure proper shipment and document preparation, while monitoring clearance status and managing issue escalation. You will also perform accurate data entry for entry filing, classifications, and inspections, as well as generate and track delivery forms while ensuring compliance requirements are met.  

  

The ideal candidate will be customer\-obsessed, detail\-driven, and passionate about international logistics. Join us as we revolutionize global commerce, one shipment at a time.  

  

Key job responsibilities  

* Verify completeness of information upon onboarding Customers
* Prepare import documentation to ensure timely release and delivery of orders
* Verify accuracy of commercial documentation and charges
* Submit documentation to regulatory agencies
* Meet daily/weekly KPI targets for entry submission and accuracy
* Collaborate with other service providers to solve shipment issues
* Collaborate with origin and destination logistics teams
* 2nd Tier support for Customer Service queries

  

About the team  

We are a collaborative group of logistics professionals dedicated to streamlining international trade processes. Our team is committed to excellence in global supply chain management, working closely with international partners to facilitate efficient and compliant cross\-border transportation. We value precision, communication, and continuous learning.**BASIC QUALIFICATIONS**
------------------------

* Knowledge of Excel at a basic level (e.g., UX navigation, math \& logical functions, lookup functions, etc.)
* Work 40 hours/week, and overtime as required
* Experience performing accurate data entry and analysis
* Experience in international logistics, cross\-border transportation and supply chain, or U.S. Customs rules and regulations
* 2\+ years of customs entry writing experience with a proven track record handling complex, high\-value shipments

**PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS**
----------------------------

* High school or equivalent diploma
* Bachelor's degree in logistics, transporation, supply chain, or business
* Licensed customs broker

  

Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of protected veteran status, disability, or other legally protected status.

title: Transportation Broker
description:
METROPARK WAREHOUSES, LLC


The **Transportation Broker** is responsible for managing daily freight operations while also taking on responsibilities typically associated with a freight broker. This role includes coordinating shipments, sourcing reliable carriers, negotiating rates, ensuring timely delivery, and maintaining strong relationships with both internal teams and external logistics partners.


**Pay:** Base Salary $60,000\.00 plus commission


**Duties and Responsibilities:**


* + Schedule and coordinate inbound and outbound freight across multiple transportation modes (e.g., FTL, LTL, intermodal)
	+ Source and secure third\-party carriers to meet shipping needs and deadlines
	+ Negotiate freight rates and confirm carrier availability and capacity
	+ Monitor shipment status and proactively resolve delays or service issues
	+ Ensure all documentation (BOLs, PODs, rate confirmations) is completed and accurate
	+ Maintain carrier and load information in transportation management systems (TMS)
	+ Track, trace, and communicate shipment updates to internal and external stakeholders
	+ Build and maintain relationships with shippers, carriers, and 3PL partners
	+ Analyze freight spend, optimize routing, and identify cost\-saving opportunities
	+ Ensure compliance with DOT, FMCSA, and company policies


**Skills and Qualifications:**


* + High school diploma or GED required; Bachelor's degree in Supply Chain, Logistics, or Business preferred
	+ 2\+ years of experience in transportation coordination, freight brokerage, or dispatching
	+ Familiarity with TMS software and load boards (e.g., DAT, Truckstop)
	+ Excellent communication, negotiation, and organizational skills
	+ Ability to multitask, prioritize, and work in a fast\-paced environment
	+ Strong understanding of freight operations, carrier networks, and DOT regulations
	+ Proficient in Microsoft Excel, Word, and logistics\-related platforms
	+ Existing relationships with regional or national carriers
	+ Experience working in a brokerage or 3PL environment


*We are an equal\-opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status.*

title: Customs Brokerage Specialist
description:
**DESCRIPTION**
---------------


Application deadline: Feb 26, 2026  

  

At Amazon, our mission is to be Earth's most Customer\-centric company. The Amazon Customs \& Trade (ACT) team delivers comprehensive customs brokerage services for our customers.  

  

We are seeking a detail\-oriented Customs Brokerage Specialist to join our team. In this role, you will manage daily customs clearance operations for ocean, air, rail, and truck cross\-border shipments. The position involves collaborating with freight forwarders, sellers, and vendors to ensure proper shipment and document preparation, while monitoring clearance status and managing issue escalation. You will also perform accurate data entry for entry filing, classifications, and inspections, as well as generate and track delivery forms while ensuring compliance requirements are met.  

  

The ideal candidate will be customer\-obsessed, detail\-driven, and passionate about international logistics. Join us as we revolutionize global commerce, one shipment at a time.  

  

Key job responsibilities  

* Verify completeness of information upon onboarding Customers
* Prepare import documentation to ensure timely release and delivery of orders
* Verify accuracy of commercial documentation and charges
* Submit documentation to regulatory agencies
* Meet daily/weekly KPI targets for entry submission and accuracy
* Collaborate with other service providers to solve shipment issues
* Collaborate with origin and destination logistics teams
* 2nd Tier support for Customer Service queries

  

About the team  

We are a collaborative group of logistics professionals dedicated to streamlining international trade processes. Our team is committed to excellence in global supply chain management, working closely with international partners to facilitate efficient and compliant cross\-border transportation. We value precision, communication, and continuous learning.**BASIC QUALIFICATIONS**
------------------------

* Knowledge of Excel at a basic level (e.g., UX navigation, math \& logical functions, lookup functions, etc.)
* Work 40 hours/week, and overtime as required
* Experience performing accurate data entry and analysis
* Experience in international logistics, cross\-border transportation and supply chain, or U.S. Customs rules and regulations
* 2\+ years of customs entry writing experience with a proven track record handling complex, high\-value shipments
* Experience in international logistics, cross\-border transportation and supply chain, or U.S. Customs rules and regulations
* 2\+ years of customs entry writing experience with a proven track record handling complex, high\-value shi

**PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS**
----------------------------

* High school or equivalent diploma
* Bachelor's degree in logistics, transporation, supply chain, or business
* Licensed customs broker

  

Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of protected veteran status, disability,...

title: Data Center Project Manager II, Critical Projects Implementation
description:
**DESCRIPTION**
---------------


AWS Infrastructure Services owns the design, planning, delivery, and operation of all AWS global infrastructure. In other words, were the people who keep the cloud running. We support all AWS data centers and all of the servers, storage, networking, power, and cooling equipment that ensure our customers have continual access to the innovation they rely on. We work on the most challenging problems, with thousands of variables impacting the supply chain  and were looking for talented people who want to help.
  

  

Youll join a diverse team of software, hardware, and network engineers, supply chain specialists, security experts, operations managers, and other vital roles. Youll collaborate with people across AWS to help us deliver the highest standards for safety and security while providing seemingly infinite capacity at the lowest possible cost for our customers. And youll experience an inclusive culture that welcomes bold ideas and empowers you to own them to completion.  

  

The Critical Projects Implementation (CPI) team is a project management and execution team that manages construction activity within the operational data center spaces. The CPI team is tasked with critical infrastructure improvement projects to optimize utilization of space, power, and cooling within operational data centers around the globe. These activities are outside of the scope of standard construction delivery and regular preventative maintenance tasks.  

  

We are currently seeking a Data Center Project Manager to serve as a technical resource within Amazon data centers. You will be part of a highly creative, efficient team tasked with tackling the most fascinating and challenges in designing, building, and operating Amazon data center facilities. The Project Manager is ultimately responsible for project oversight and review of all disciplines including electrical, mechanical, controls, and architectural. A fundamental understanding of these systems is required, as the individual will be expected to identify areas for improvement as well as act on data provided from other team and organizations. Ideal candidates will possess the ability to design, develop and deploy innovative solutions to address operational challenges. This role requires both independent contribution as well as the ability to work within multi\-disciplinary teams. The scope of projects will include but not limited to the improvement of electrical, mechanical, fire detection and building automation system. The Project Manager is responsible for the overall direction, coordination, implementation, execution, control and completion of specific projects ensuring consistency with company strategy, commitments and goals.  

  

About the team  

Why AWS  

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the worlds most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating  thats why customers from the most successful star...
